title: The Liberation Wars
opening: By the time Leif had finished the last of the fighting in Leonster and departed for Ulster, the city had already fallen to the Isaachian Liberation Army led by Lord Seliph. However, the head of House Friege, King Bloom, had escaped to Conote. In the now-liberated Ulster, Leif finally met his cousin, a man who would be his friend and ally for the rest of his days: the "Scion of Light" and Lord of House Chalphy, Seliph...

intro.speaker: Julia
intro.line: Lord Seliph, we should head back soon...

intro.speaker: Seliph
intro.line: Ah, Julia, are we out of time already? I wish we could keep talking, Prince Leif, but I must be going. Leave the conquest of Conote to us—I bid you go straight to Manster.

intro.speaker: Leif
intro.line: I pray you forgive my selfishness, Lord Seliph.

intro.speaker: Seliph
intro.line: Nonsense, you're not being selfish at all! I understand your feelings perfectly. You can head to Munster with a clean conscience—I'll see you soon.

intro.speaker: Leif
intro.line: Yes, in Munster! You can count on it!

intro.speaker: Julia
intro.line: I'll be praying for your health, Lord Leif... If your fortune begins to wane, perhaps one of your own clerics could appeal to the gods. I believe there's a church on your route... It was built to receive the prayers of the Ducal Family of Tarrah, as I recall...

intro.speaker: Leif
intro.line: Thank you, Lady Julia. Just don't forget to take care of yourself, too.

intro.speaker: August
intro.line: How went your meeting with Lord Seliph, my prince?

intro.speaker: Leif
intro.line: He and I are only a year apart, but he's such an incredible man...

intro.speaker: August
intro.line: Indeed. He commands an army ten times the size of ours, and he was able to lead them across the Aed Desert. He's certainly not your ordinary youth...

intro.speaker: Leif
intro.line: But you said before that he was "made" into a hero, did you not?

intro.speaker: August
intro.line: I did say that, yes—and in one sense, it's true. But I'm not discounting that Lord Seliph himself possesses outstanding talent. I suspect he'll eclipse the legend of his father, Lord Sigurd, by quite some measure.

intro.speaker: Leif
intro.line: And meanwhile, I'm still just an embarrassment to Leonster...

intro.speaker: August
intro.line: You've grown much over the past year, my prince—in another year, I expect you'll be the same caliber of man as Lord Seliph. Now, putting that aside, what did you and he agree would be the plans for our armies, going forward?

intro.speaker: Leif
intro.line: Lord Seliph's main forces will go east along the shore to seize Conote, as planned.

intro.speaker: August
intro.line: Which frees our army to head for Fort Danzig, correct?

intro.speaker: Leif
intro.line: Indeed. Lord Seliph readily granted my request. Leaving Conote to Seliph means we can focus all our energy on seizing Munster—I want to head there as soon as possible.

intro.speaker: August
intro.line: We'll have to claim Fort Danzig regardless—it controls the inland route to Munster.

intro.speaker: Diarmuid
intro.line: The army stands ready, Prince Leif. We await your command.

intro.speaker: Leif
intro.line: Then there's no time to lose! We storm Fort Danzig!

intro.speaker: Seimetol
intro.line: Everybody remembers we fight for pay, right? So don't be a hero! Wait for the enemy to break up their forces, THEN swoop in! Until then, nobody leave their post!

visit.speaker: Bishop
visit.line: Ah... You're Duchess Linoan of Tarrah, are you not?

visit.speaker: Linoan
visit.line: Hm? How do you know who I am?

visit.speaker: Bishop
visit.line: I grew up with your father. He and I didn't know each other particularly well, but I was also good friends with your late mother. I nearly mistook you for her when you walked in—the resemblance is uncanny.

visit.speaker: Bishop
visit.line: Oh, heavens! I didn't mean to upset you. Er... I take it you're with Prince Leif? I saw you fighting together outside.

visit.speaker: Linoan
visit.line: I am with the Liberation Army, yes.

visit.speaker: Bishop
visit.line: Mm... It seems the blood of the crusaders is drawn to conflict...

visit.speaker: Linoan
visit.line: Blood of the crusaders? You don't mean... I have holy blood?

visit.speaker: Bishop
visit.line: Eh? Your father didn't tell you? The Ducal House of Tarrah is descended from Saint Heim, the first of the Grannvale kings.

visit.speaker: Linoan
visit.line: I have... the blood of Saint Heim...?

visit.speaker: Bishop
visit.line: You mean to say you never realized you bore the power of Naga herself...? Follow me. I can awaken the holy blood that lay dormant in your veins.

visit.speaker: Bishop
visit.line: The fighting will only become more intense as you draw closer to the Imperial base to the east. Keep hold of this Pure Water. I'm sure it will come in handy.

boss.speaker: Fraus
boss.line: On my honor as a soldier, I'll defend this fort to the end!

boss.speaker: Fraus
boss.line: So I... made it out alive? But what am I going to do now...?

boss.speaker: Seimetol
boss.line: Your Majesty... I'm sorry... I... couldn't...

boss.speaker: Seimetol
boss.line: How am I ever gonna make it up to His Majesty...?

end.speaker: Leif
end.line: August! This can't be an ordinary fort—there are too many guards for that!

end.speaker: August
end.line: By the look of it, this place is being used as a prison camp. The enemy has likely started executing prisoners because of our attack.

end.speaker: Leif
end.line: What?! Then there's not a moment to lose! We have to rescue the prisoners!

end.speaker: August
end.line: Our forces are already exhausting themselves, Prince Leif. Besides, we have intelligence that a battalion of Loptian mages are en route. Please, we need to withdraw while we can!

end.speaker: Leif
end.line: No, August! I won't! I'll not abandon my comrades-in-arms to the enemy's clutches! I'll free them alone if I have to!

end.speaker: August
end.line: *Sigh* I suppose this is unavoidable... At least limit yourself to a small handful of troops, and let the others rest.

end.speaker: Leif
end.line: Anything of import inside the fort, August?

end.speaker: August
end.line: Hmm... The fort is completely vacant. Seems to be deserted. By the look of it, this place was once a prison camp, but it's not in use anymore.

end.speaker: Leif
end.line: I see. Then if there's nothing requiring our attention, we should hurry ahead to the River Thracia. Once we cross it, we'll be at Munster's doorstep.

end.speaker: August
end.line: Hah... Easier said than done, my prince. I've no doubt the enemy is waiting for us—they likely have established a defensive line at the river. We still have some way to go before our goal. See that you don't let your guard down.
